document.heading: Medicare Supplement Insurance Minimum Standards Amendment Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-202, the “Medicare Supplement Insurance Minimum Standards Amendment Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-627. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 3, 1996, and July 17, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 5, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-367 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-202 became effective on April 9, 1997.

meta.search-text: ENROLLMENT(S) kwiktag 062 319 270 ENROLLED ORIGINAL AN ACT D.C, ACT 11-367 IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AUGUST 5, 1996 Codi) ication District o) Columbia Code 1997 Sopp. To amend the Medicare Supplement Insurance Minimum Standards Act of 1992 in order to implement requirements of the Medicare supplement minimum standards as mandated by the Social Security Act Amendments of 1994. These changes to the regulatory programs will ensure that the District of Columbia maintains approval as meeting minimum federal standards. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Medicare Supplement Insurance Minimum Standards Amendment Act of 1996 Sec. 2. The Medicare Supplement Insurance Minimum Standards Act of 1992, effective October 1, 1992 (D.C. Law 9-170, D.C. Code § 35-2611 et seq is amended as follows a) Section 2(6 D.C. Section (b) Section 3(a D.C. Code § 35-2612(a is amended by striking the phrase "in 35-2612 section 5 c) Section 3(c D.C. Limitations of actions Any action challenging the validity of or arising out of acts taken or proposed to be taken under this act shall be commenced within 30 days after the effective date of any plan submitted for approval pursuant to this act Sec. 5. Effective date.
